excerpts: and I got the vegetable spring rolls.
Pretty simple: shredded cabbage and carrots, but the dipping sauce (a sweet chili sauce?) was amazing.
vegetable spring rolls.author: Kelly L.
vegetable spring rolls.review:
This place is great for vegetarians and vegans! The ingredients are listed on the menu to assure you that certain dishes do not contain any animal products. Additionally, the portions are huge, so you can easily squeak two meals out of one entree. 

For an appetizer, my boyfriend and I got the vegetable spring rolls. Pretty simple: shredded cabbage and carrots, but the dipping sauce (a sweet chili sauce?) was amazing.  For an entree, I ordered the Sesame Meatless Chicken with Broccoli, which was so yum. My boyfriend had the Kung Pao Meatless Prawns, which was also very good. It came with lots of sauteed veggies (peppers and onions) in a light sauce. The meatless prawns looked like actual prawns, which always freaks me out since I've never eaten seafood, but they were really good nonetheless. I'm really impressed that this restaurant decided to offer something other than tofu or meatless chicken. 

I don't think they have any vegan options for dessert, but you do get unlimited hot tea with your meal, which was a nice bonus.

I definitely plan to go back soon, and when I do, I think I'm going for the General Tso or the Lemon Meatless Chicken. I'll let you know ;-)

excerpts: We ordered the small hot and sour soup, green onion pancakes, vegetable chowmein and sweet and sour chicken.
The hot and sour soup was really bad-
it left a strange aftertaste in our mouths, the egg was rubbery and the vegetables tasted like the chemicals and pesticides hadn't been washed off.
The green onion pancakes were also disappointing, they were crispy on the outside and on the inside, the flavor was bland and there were not enough green onions.
Now for the good food- the chowmein was DELICIOUS!!
The vegetables and noodles were so good we honestly thought they had to have MSG.
The sweet and sour chicken was also good, especially with the chowmein.
The sauce was nice, although the chicken was chewy it was still good.
I would come here again for the chowmein but might try other food with it.
green onion pancakes.author: Kulmeher D.
green onion pancakes.review: This food was extremely hit or miss- we were honestly surprised that the menu said no MSG cause we could have sworn some of the food tasted so good it could have only been made with MSG- but what do we know!! We ordered the small hot and sour soup, green onion pancakes, vegetable chowmein and sweet and sour chicken. The hot and sour soup was really bad- it left a strange aftertaste in our mouths, the egg was rubbery and the vegetables tasted like the chemicals and pesticides hadn't been washed off. The green onion pancakes were also disappointing, they were crispy on the outside and on the inside, the flavor was bland and there were not enough green onions. Now for the good food- the chowmein was DELICIOUS!! The vegetables and noodles were so good we honestly thought they had to have MSG. The sweet and sour chicken was also good, especially with the chowmein. The sauce was nice, although the chicken was chewy it was still good. I would come here again for the chowmein but might try other food with it.

excerpts: The green onion pancakes were lacking on the green onion so the flavor profile was not as intense as I expected.
The food overall was ok, not the best, but not the worst.

My only major problem with this place was that about halfway through the meal, I noticed that parts of the lids of the takeout containers were broken and I could not find the fragments that broke off.
green onion pancakes.author: Julie L.
green onion pancakes.review: Food is decent for Chinese takeout. Delivery said it would take about 50 minutes and the food came within 60 minutes so not too shabby. The green onion pancakes were lacking on the green onion so the flavor profile was not as intense as I expected. The food overall was ok, not the best, but not the worst. My only major problem with this place was that about halfway through the meal, I noticed that parts of the lids of the takeout containers were broken and I could not find the fragments that broke off.

excerpts: We will definitely come back to try the Korean Spicy Wings, Green Onion Pancakes & Green Beans from the vegetarian selections.
green onion pancakes.author: Cynthia F.
green onion pancakes.review:
My cousin took me and my husband to Kung Food. I love Hunan cuisine and this place, I thought, is just the right place.  I was not disappointed. For appetizers, we ordered Fried Calamari and Shanghai Style Dumplings. Sweet and Sour Soup and Fried Egg Rolls were complementary. I had Hunan Chicken, my husband had Mongolian Beef & my cousin had custom made non spicy stir fried all beef with egg noodles.

The menu has salad selections and various healthy menu options. The sauces were very good, not too spicy. The Hunan Chicken had generous pieces of chicken breast. The food is neither salty nor was it greasy and, it is reasonably priced!

We will definitely come back to try the Korean Spicy Wings, Green Onion Pancakes & Green Beans from the vegetarian selections.

excerpts: I get the Mongolian beef and green onion pancakes which are both delicious.
Delivery is always quick and the food is hot.
If you want soup I highly recommend the won ton soup.
green onion pancakes.author: Darius A.
green onion pancakes.review: My go to delivery spot when I am craving Chinese food. I get the Mongolian beef and green onion pancakes which are both delicious. Delivery is always quick and the food is hot. If you want soup I highly recommend the won ton soup.

excerpts: As a way of rectifying the situation, they even offered me free green onion pancakes.
The food overall was really great, and I'd come back here again.
You can't beat the prices, and they have lots of vegetarian stuff on the menu too.
Seems like a very well-run, small neighborhood restaurant that cares about their customers.
For what it's worth, the chow mein noodles were some of the tastiest noodles I've had!
green onion pancakes.author: Zach S.
green onion pancakes.review: Went here last week and ordered the chow fun.  They accidentally made the wrong dish, but I didn't mind.  The owner apologized and I think even offered to re-make the dish, but the dish they prepared for me instead (chow mein noodles) looked great so I ate it.  As a way of rectifying the situation, they even offered me free green onion pancakes.  The food overall was really great, and I'd come back here again.  You can't beat the prices, and they have lots of vegetarian stuff on the menu too.  Seems like a very well-run, small neighborhood restaurant that cares about their customers.  For what it's worth, the chow mein noodles were some of the tastiest noodles I've had!

excerpts: We had the avocado egg rolls, sweet & sour chicken, Hunan spicy dragon beef, and chicken fried rice.
I'd say it was good but not 5 stars amazing.
I'm a bit perplexed by so many 5 star reviews.
Our favorites were the spicy dragon beef & avocado egg rolls; the sweet and sour chicken was a bit bland & dry, and the chicken fried rice seemed a little bit dry too but edible.
Given they've only been open a week
I'm a bit more forgiving, but definitely not blown away.

I'm sure they will do well as there are no options for Chinese food in the neighborhood, but I think we'll stick with Wonderland Chinese food in the lower Haight...maybe try them again in a few months.
avocado egg rolls.author: Desiree P.
avocado egg rolls.review:
My husband and I tried this place out for the first time last night. We live in the neighborhood & were happy to see a new affordable restaurant in the area open up. We had the avocado egg rolls, sweet & sour chicken, Hunan spicy dragon beef, and chicken fried rice. I'd say it was good but not 5 stars amazing. I'm a bit perplexed by so many 5 star reviews. Maybe people are just happy it's not another pizza place? 

Our favorites were the spicy dragon beef & avocado egg rolls; the sweet and sour chicken was a bit bland & dry, and the chicken fried rice seemed a little bit dry too but edible. Given they've only been open a week I'm a bit more forgiving, but definitely not blown away. I'm sure they will do well as there are no options for Chinese food in the neighborhood, but I think we'll stick with Wonderland Chinese food in the lower Haight...maybe try them again in a few months.

excerpts: The only thing we weren't a big fan of was the avocado egg rolls.
Those we could've done without.
Aside from that 5 starts on everything!!
avocado egg rolls.author: Marlo M.
avocado egg rolls.review: This place is amazing! The food is delicious and the service is great (props to the waiter for singing in Spanish!! Lol) The Hunan butter beef dish and the dry sautéed string beans were our top favorite! Definitely a must!!! The schezuan chicken was really good! For appetizers we got the combo plate which was good! The only thing we weren't a big fan of was the avocado egg rolls. Those we could've done without. Aside from that 5 starts on everything!!

excerpts: Also had the avocado egg rolls!
Delish!
The owner Andy is super sweet and very attentive to his customers, he seems to recognize his regulars as well which is something that I always appreciate...
One thing I will say after reading the other reviews is that, yes, my to go container w my leftovers leaked too..
But I am willing to over look that minor detail!
I will be back!
avocado egg rolls.author: Christiana C.
avocado egg rolls.review: Been on the hunt for a go to Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood... It's safe to say I have finally found it! Usually I order form yum yum Hunan, but let's be real, too expensive for mediocre food... After walking by various times, I decided to give Kung Food a try! For my first visit I decided to dine in, and was super pleased with the ambience, and was very very impressed by the service I was given... In ordered the "chefs special A" which was garlic eggplant w chicken AND shrimp! What more could one ask for! Also had the avocado egg rolls! Delish! The owner Andy is super sweet and very attentive to his customers, he seems to recognize his regulars as well which is something that I always appreciate... One thing I will say after reading the other reviews is that, yes, my to go container w my leftovers leaked too.. But I am willing to over look that minor detail! I will be back!

excerpts: Chow mein, avocado egg rolls, and basil tofu were all excellent.
They are still working out some kinks, but overall, very good food and a great experience.
Definitely coming back - this will be a regular spot for us.
avocado egg rolls.author: Stevan D.
avocado egg rolls.review: Great little neighborhood Chinese restaurant.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Tons of great vegetarian items on the menu.  Vegetables tasted fresh and not too greasy, portions were huge,  prices were very reasonable.  Chow mein, avocado egg rolls, and basil tofu were all excellent.  They are still working out some kinks, but overall, very good food and a great experience.  Definitely coming back - this will be a regular spot for us.

excerpts: Pork Wontons, Crab Rangoon , Pork Pot Stickers were outstanding.
The Pork Potstickers were the best dumplings I ever had.
We also had the Korean Fried Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Sweet and Sour Prawns.
Serving sizes were large and everything was delicious!
Would go back in a heartbeat!
If I lived here - I would be here every week at the minimum.
Great place!
crab rangoon.author: Patrick A.
crab rangoon.review:
By far the best Chinese food I have had in San Francisco (or anywhere else for that matter) - and it wasn't even in China town. The restaurant is a small, quaint place traditionally decorated. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. 

Pork Wontons, Crab Rangoon , Pork Pot Stickers were outstanding. The Pork Potstickers were the best dumplings I ever had. We also had the Korean Fried Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Sweet and Sour Prawns. Serving sizes were large and everything was delicious!  Would go back in a heartbeat!  If I lived here - I would be here every week at the minimum. Great place!

excerpts:
General Tso's, and crab rangoon.

The veggie chow mein was tasteless, the dim sum was bland, and the crab rangoon was really fishy and the shell was thick and tough.
crab rangoon.author: Emma B.
crab rangoon.review:
This place was just OK for American Chinese food delivery. There are other places in the city I like more and I don't plan on ordering from here again.

I got the veggie chow mein, pork potstickers, dim sum combination plate (two pork buns, two shrimp dumplings, two sui mai), General Tso's, and crab rangoon.

The veggie chow mein was tasteless, the dim sum was bland, and the crab rangoon was really fishy and the shell was thick and tough.

The General Tso's was the best dish, but still pretty average. I was pleased with the delivery time - it came quicker than estimated. The portions were also generous.

excerpts: I especially like the crab rangoon and chicken dishes.
crab rangoon.author: Renee F.
crab rangoon.review: This was my go-to chinese food (delivery or carry-out) in my neighborhood.  This says a lot as I'mp picky abouy chinese food.  Very fast and good!  I especially like the crab rangoon and chicken dishes.

excerpts: Awesome service and pretty good crab Rangoon's .
The portions are pretty good size for the price .
My favorite cheap and easy Chinese place in town
crab rangoon.author: Noah M.
crab rangoon.review: Awesome service and pretty good crab Rangoon's . The portions are pretty good size for the price . My favorite cheap and easy Chinese place in town

excerpts: got mu shu pork, general tso's chicken and crab rangoon
- all were good, delivered hot and in 45 mins.
crab rangoon.author: Erica W.
crab rangoon.review: Best Chinese delivery in the area. got mu shu pork, general tso's chicken and crab rangoon - all were good, delivered hot and in 45 mins.

excerpts: Get the crab Rangoon.
This place is very clean and the staff is so friendly.
They also gave free delivery which you just can't beat.
Good bang for your buck.
crab rangoon.author: Jenna G.
crab rangoon.review:
AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE. Get the crab Rangoon. 
This place is very clean and the staff is so friendly. They also gave free delivery which you just can't beat. Good bang for your buck.

excerpts: Crab Rangoon: seemed fresh but undercooked, the dough was soft, and not crispy.
The crab tasted like imitation crab.
Sadly, I asked for extra hot mustard when ordering.
crab rangoon.author: William R.
crab rangoon.review:
Living in the Nopa/Castro area we have been waiting for a good Chinese food restaurant. Kung Food placed a flyer at our door so figured we would check it out. 

Tonight we ordered the following:

Mu Shu Pork: bland, far too much cabbage with large pieces that broke through the pancake.

Crispy Dragon Beef: not too bad but perhaps too crispy, making it over cooked. 

Crab Rangoon: seemed fresh but undercooked, the dough was soft, and not crispy. The crab tasted like imitation crab. Sadly, I asked for extra hot mustard when ordering. The lady that answered confirmed extra hot mustard but unfortunately no mustard was delivered at all. 

We got a free fried rice with the order but it lacked flavor, was dry, and clumpy. 

Ultimately we were disappointed with the meal. The order did not come as expected (no hot mustard), they do not deliver chopsticks, they do not deliver soy sauce or hot sauce. The food was desperate for seasoning.

Everything tasted like it was cooked earlier and mildly re-heated. Perhaps if they cut the menu in half and focused on clean, fresh, ingredients, the food would be better.

excerpts: I loved the black mushroom veggie dish we got and the crab Rangoon is fresh and made from scratch.
They are generous with their portions.
This is why there's a delay on orders.
They do need to run their businesses more systematically to handle volume
so I hope they'll see that the feedback here at yelp will help them succeed.
There's limited seating and they need to get rid of the carpet in the dining room
but it's nicely decorated inside.
This neighborhood needs restaurants like Kung Food.
crab rangoon.author: Priya S.
crab rangoon.review: Growing up with a mother who is a chef, I learned just how much passion and effort it takes to create a restaurant that attempts to rewrite how a certain type of food is made. My mom rewrote Indian food. Kung Foid rewrites Chinese. Kung Food makes Chinese food with fresh veggies and from scratch. I loved the black mushroom veggie dish we got and the crab Rangoon is fresh and made from scratch. They are generous with their portions. This is why there's a delay on orders. They do need to run their businesses more systematically to handle volume so I hope they'll see that the feedback here at yelp will help them succeed. There's limited seating and they need to get rid of the carpet in the dining room but it's nicely decorated inside. This neighborhood needs restaurants like Kung Food.

excerpts: We got the cumin lamb, rock cod fillet in black bean sauce, sauteed string beans, korean chicken wings, and crab rangoon.
My favorite was the rock cod - the flavor was really delicate and the bean sauce wasn't overpowering.
The string beans were great - not overlooked and still crunchy.
The cumin lamb was flavorful, but could have used more cumin (just my personal preference for cumin).
The chicken wings were hot and crispy, and a little sweet.
And the crab rangoon was surprisingly good, with real crab bits.
Note that the space is tiny - it probably seats about 25 people, so anticipate a wait for dinner time on a weekend.
And as everyone has said, the owner is super nice and friendly.
crab rangoon.author: E. C. P.
crab rangoon.review: I have to be honest - I don't really like Chinese food. And I'm Chinese. However, I did like Kung Food. We got the cumin lamb, rock cod fillet in black bean sauce, sauteed string beans, korean chicken wings, and crab rangoon. My favorite was the rock cod - the flavor was really delicate and the bean sauce wasn't overpowering. The string beans were great - not overlooked and still crunchy. The cumin lamb was flavorful, but could have used more cumin (just my personal preference for cumin). The chicken wings were hot and crispy, and a little sweet. And the crab rangoon was surprisingly good, with real crab bits. Note that the space is tiny - it probably seats about 25 people, so anticipate a wait for dinner time on a weekend. And as everyone has said, the owner is super nice and friendly.

excerpts: Fried foods were mushy, string beans were not seasoned, crab rangoon was baffling and tasted like past-due fish, beef was gray and rubbery, fried rice was just streamed rice with some vegetables and meats thrown on top.
I have no idea why this place has four stars and a location on Divisadero.
We are not picky eaters, but we could barely touch this crap.
And we are definitely not wasteful, but 100% of what we didn't eat that night went straight into the garbage can.
So disappointed.
crab rangoon.author: Aaron G.
crab rangoon.review: Fried foods were mushy, string beans were not seasoned, crab rangoon was baffling and tasted like past-due fish, beef was gray and rubbery, fried rice was just streamed rice with some vegetables and meats thrown on top. I have no idea why this place has four stars and a location on Divisadero. We are not picky eaters, but we could barely touch this crap. And we are definitely not wasteful, but 100% of what we didn't eat that night went straight into the garbage can. So disappointed.

excerpts: Its nice to find a place that really knows how to make a tasty crab rangoon.
I definitely recommend this place and will be going back soon.
I think I might become a regular.
crab rangoon.author: Rose S.
crab rangoon.review: This place is great! FINALLY an inexpensive delicious chinese food place in the neighborhood! The staff was warm, inviting and was very attentive. The restaurant was nice and clean.  The food was very delicious. If you like San Tung chicken wings then you will enjoy the Korean Chicken Wings. The beef chow mein  wasn't too greasy and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The sesame chicken was nice and juicy with big pieces of chicken. Pot stickers, spring rolls, chicken wings and crab rangoons full of chunks of crab and minimal to non existant cream cheese are all highly recommended. Its nice to find a place that really knows how to make a tasty crab rangoon. I definitely recommend this place and will be going back soon.  I think I might become a regular.

excerpts: Pork Wontons, Crab Rangoon , Pork Pot Stickers were outstanding.
The Pork Potstickers were the best dumplings I ever had.
We also had the Korean Fried Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Sweet and Sour Prawns.
Serving sizes were large and everything was delicious!
Would go back in a heartbeat!
If I lived here - I would be here every week at the minimum.
Great place!
pork pot stickers.author: Patrick A.
pork pot stickers.review:
By far the best Chinese food I have had in San Francisco (or anywhere else for that matter) - and it wasn't even in China town. The restaurant is a small, quaint place traditionally decorated. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. 

Pork Wontons, Crab Rangoon , Pork Pot Stickers were outstanding. The Pork Potstickers were the best dumplings I ever had. We also had the Korean Fried Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Sweet and Sour Prawns. Serving sizes were large and everything was delicious!  Would go back in a heartbeat!  If I lived here - I would be here every week at the minimum. Great place!

excerpts: I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with a side of fried rice and an order of vegetable pot stickers.
The pot stickers were deep-fried, which was unexpected
but I was curious to try.
They were rubbery and flavorless.
The fried rice was so salty I could taste nothing else.
The orange chicken was tough and dry.
I could only stomach a few bites of both.
Just because I was hungry doesn't mean I was going subject myself to that.
I didn't try the soup that came with the meal out of fear of what it might taste like.
The only decent thing was the free egg roll.
vegetable pot stickers.author: Angee R.
vegetable pot stickers.review:
I figured I'd write this review while my food is in the trash and the awful experience is fresh in my mind. There are a few Chinese restaurants in the city I usually order them but today I decided to try something new. I find myself hungry, upset that I wasted $17(tip included), and wishing I had ordered from somewhere else. 
 
The service I received was horrible. That alone is enough to stop me from ever ordering there again. I wish that was all that was wrong because the way I see it even though the lack of customer service would have made sure this would the first and last time I ever gave them my money I would have decent or good food. Unfortunately, that was not the case.

I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with a side of fried rice and an order of vegetable pot stickers. The pot stickers were deep-fried, which was unexpected but I was curious to try. They were rubbery and flavorless. The fried rice was so salty I could taste nothing else. The orange chicken was tough and dry. I could only stomach a few bites of both. Just because I was hungry doesn't mean I was going subject myself to that. I didn't try the soup that came with the meal out of fear of what it might taste like. The only decent thing was the free egg roll.

excerpts: I understand that it's not a genuine authentic Chinese restaurant, but when I ordered their twice cooked pork, it was literally bbq pork with some vegetables - cabbage, carrots, bell peppers, and onions.
bbq pork.author: Ada C.
bbq pork.review:
I was so disappointed with Kung Food when I came here on a Saturday night. I understand that it's not a genuine authentic Chinese restaurant, but when I ordered their twice cooked pork, it was literally bbq pork with some vegetables - cabbage, carrots, bell peppers, and onions. It wasn't even twice cooked, which really defeats the dish's name and was misleading. 

The chow mein was pretty tasty, but a little oily. I lost my appetite after the twice cooked pork dish came out. The ambiance was nice however, a little distracting with the staff changing the music constantly to various artists and music genres.

excerpts: They know my name, what I want - and even make sure I get my pot-sticker sauce with my BBQ Pork Steamed Buns (
YUMM - you gotta try it!).
I am partial to the Orange Chicken which I like hot but specify your spice level for sure.
the food is great and tastes even better when you heat it up the next day as the portions are too generous for one sitting.
I highly recommend you not only eat here, but make friends with these guys - they treat me like family when I call.
bbq pork.author: Kevin M.
bbq pork.review: Andy and Lei Lei run a personalized family business. I order from them at least a few times a month. They know my name, what I want - and even make sure I get my pot-sticker sauce with my BBQ Pork Steamed Buns (YUMM - you gotta try it!). I am partial to the Orange Chicken which I like hot but specify your spice level for sure. the food is great and tastes even better when you heat it up the next day as the portions are too generous for one sitting. I highly recommend you not only eat here, but make friends with these guys - they treat me like family when I call.

excerpts: we ordered bbq pork fried rice..sweet n sour pork..chicken chow mein..
Mongolian beef n potstickers..we liked the potstickers..we usually finish the food but not this time around..
bbq pork.author: Jo S.
bbq pork.review: Wanted to try out this place from reading the reviews..sorry folks but not for me..the food here  was not as good as some of the places that I have eaten before..the people are friendly, and the service was good..hence the 3 stars ..but the food was just average we ordered bbq pork fried rice..sweet n sour pork..chicken chow mein..Mongolian beef n potstickers..we liked the potstickers..we usually finish the food but not this time around..

excerpts: My other go tos are the BBQ pork fried rice, Generals chicken, Mongolian beef, and Hot & Sour soup.
Nothing disappointed!
bbq pork.author: Jenee Y.
bbq pork.review:
I've been to this place twice since they opened down the street from where I live and the food is delicious. 

The portions here are very generous and our server, who I believe to be the son of the family that owns the restaurant, was very friendly and informative. He recommended a special that I believe was called the butter beef: tender sautéed filet mignon with greens and scallion, this dish blew my mind. My other go tos are the BBQ pork fried rice, Generals chicken, Mongolian beef, and Hot & Sour soup. Nothing disappointed!

excerpts: And the bbq pork was grey and tired.
bbq pork.author: Zach S.
bbq pork.review:
Gross!  Ordered a chicken salad and pork chow mein for to go.  The chicken salad was not what I was expecting at all, and was covered with a pink mayonaise type goop.  It was so nasty looking I threw the entire box straight into the garbage.  Maybe it was delicious, but it looked like vomit.

The pork chow mein was also gross.  Raw red onion.  That's just not right.  Also, loads of undercooked semi-raw bits of garlic.  And the bbq pork was grey and tired.  

These good reviews are very misleading.  This food was straight up nasty in my opinion.  I hate to write a bad review, but I saw all these good reviews and thought I'd give it a try.

excerpts: One of the menu items was the dimsum combination plate.
combination plate.author: S K.
combination plate.review:
If this is the only Chinese place within miles, I would probably give it a begrudging pass. But this is in the city with the oldest Chinatown in the US, the bar must be set much higher.
This is a review of the delivery service.
When we placed the order, the delivery time was 45-60 minutes. We did not get our order for 1:45. This is already a big no-no. The restaurant did not call to let us know the delay.
One of the menu items was the dimsum combination plate. It says on the menu that it includes 2 of each of the items, shrimp dumplings, pork buns and siu mai. So we were expecting 2 shrimp dumplings, 2 pork buns, and 2 siu mai. Imagine our surprise when we found 4 shrimp dumplings, 2 siu mai, and no pork buns! Another big no-no!

Let's not even take into consideration that if this is take-out food, you will probably want utensils. None was to be found!

OK, now let's get into the food itself. The dimsum was just OK, our expectations completely ruined by the discrepancy in the actual items.
The walnut prawns was not bad. But remember what I said about the location? Take a walk down to Wonderland and you will find much better walnut prawns.
The Hunan tofu was decent, probably the best dish we got. The Yang Chow fried rice was so-so. Again, I've had better, probably Red Jade.

Overall, I think if I rate the food itself, it's probably 3.5 stars. But the service was definitely subpar. Remember, this is San Francisco, competition is going to be stiff at best.
We will probably not get food from here again.

excerpts: I got the veggie chow mein, pork potstickers, dim sum combination plate (two pork buns, two shrimp dumplings, two sui mai),
combination plate.author: Emma B.
combination plate.review:
This place was just OK for American Chinese food delivery. There are other places in the city I like more and I don't plan on ordering from here again.

I got the veggie chow mein, pork potstickers, dim sum combination plate (two pork buns, two shrimp dumplings, two sui mai), General Tso's, and crab rangoon.

The veggie chow mein was tasteless, the dim sum was bland, and the crab rangoon was really fishy and the shell was thick and tough.

The General Tso's was the best dish, but still pretty average. I was pleased with the delivery time - it came quicker than estimated. The portions were also generous.

excerpts: For appetizers, we got the Korean chicken wings and dim sum combination plate.
They were so freaking good.
combination plate.author: Iya J.
combination plate.review:
I LOVE KUNG FOOD!

I went to Kung Food Saturday night with my boyfriend. My boyfriend lives only a block away from Kung Food and before that, there were no Chinese restaurants in that neighborhood. Not really sure why. We were hesitant to try it at first but one day decided to give it a shot. For appetizers, we got the Korean chicken wings and dim sum combination plate. They were so freaking good. We got our food in less than 10 minutes, including our main entrée.

For the main entrée, we got the Hunan Crispy Dragon Beef. It was so delicious that I had dreams about it that night. For $9.75, the portion was enough to feed like 3 people. We had eaten so much but still had plenty of leftovers for the next day. 

Service was excellent. Andy is so nice and he gives the best customer service ever. He is always smiling and very polite. 

I'd also like to mention that I left my debit card here and when I came back the next day, the cashier gave it to me. I was very impressed with the honesty of the people working here.

Andy, I read your comments regarding the one star reviews you got. I feel you!!! Don't mind the haters as your restaurant will be very successful. 

I cannot wait to go back to this place. I'm pretty sure I will be back this week. =)

excerpts: The Sweet & Sour Chicken ROCKS, the Basil Tofu will go to any vegetarian's heart, and the Combination Plate is where it's at.
Beware that portions are HUGE
: I stuffed myself at dinner with my friend and evenly split the leftovers with my boyfriend the next day.
It was awesome.
Thanks for being a great staple in the neighborhood!
I'll definitely be going here any time I crave Chinese food.
combination plate.author: Eileen T.
combination plate.review:
Great little spot just off of Divis with prices that would make you think SF *isn't really* being taken over by new money. Service was perfect - kind and courteous without being in-your-face, so my friend and I got everything we needed when we needed it, plus had a relaxing conversation over dinner. We didn't feel rushed at all even though the place is pretty small and could easily get a 'dinner rush'. Decor is adorable... a mix of traditional Chinese with bits of urban flair. 
The food is on point with just the right balance of spice and savory flavor - across the board with either veggies, tofu or meat (hard to find places that get all 3 right). The Sweet & Sour Chicken ROCKS, the Basil Tofu will go to any vegetarian's heart, and the Combination Plate is where it's at. Beware that portions are HUGE: I stuffed myself at dinner with my friend and evenly split the leftovers with my boyfriend the next day. It was awesome. 
Thanks for being a great staple in the neighborhood! I'll definitely be going here any time I crave Chinese food.

excerpts: I ordered the vegetable sizzling rice soup & shrimp dumplings.
Both are excellent!
The soup is full of zucchini, asparagus, mushroom, carrot & watercress.
Yum!
Go checkout why everybody is raving about Kung Food.
vegetable sizzling rice soup.author: Susan L.
vegetable sizzling rice soup.review: This newly open restaurant in NOPA is perfect for those cold San Francisco nights. I ordered the vegetable sizzling rice soup & shrimp dumplings. Both are excellent! The soup is full of zucchini, asparagus, mushroom, carrot & watercress. Yum! Go checkout why everybody is raving about Kung Food.

excerpts: I recommend the chicken wonton soup.
chicken wonton soup.author: Andrea T.
chicken wonton soup.review: Cheap lunch special until 3pm with a variety of entree options that come with a side of rice, soup and an egg roll.  Super quick delivery, but pretty small delivery zone.  3 stars only because my beef brócoli had wayyyy to many garlic pieces that made it difficult to finish.  I recommend the chicken wonton soup.

excerpts: Loved there mixed seafood soup!
Love ordering take out here.
Delivery as scheduled.
Didn't come with rice though.
That was a surprise
seafood soup.author: O K.
seafood soup.review: Portions are great! Loved there mixed seafood soup! Love ordering take out here. Delivery as scheduled. Didn't come with rice though. That was a surprise

excerpts: In the we ordered General Tsao tofu with mushrooms, Veggie Delight, and Basil Tofu (make it spicy please).
The food came out super quick.
I loved my General Tsao tofu, the Basil tofu was absolutely delicious, although the veggie delight was a little bland.
I loved my General Tsao tofu, the Basil tofu was absolutely delicious, although the veggie delight was a little bland.
general tsao tofu.author: Anonymous R.
general tsao tofu.review:
Small. Fast. Delicious. Clean. Friendly. Cheap. And a clever name as an added bonus. 

We walked in and told the guy working there were needed something fast. "No problem" he said. We sat ourselves down in one of the six (?) tables and ordered. The hot and sour soup came super fast... And was extremely delicious. Meanwhile, the waiter continued to be warm and friendly while our order became increasingly indecisive. In the we ordered General Tsao tofu with mushrooms, Veggie Delight, and Basil Tofu (make it spicy please). The food came out super quick. I loved my General Tsao tofu, the Basil tofu was absolutely delicious, although the veggie delight was a little bland. 

In the end, it was absolutely worth the stomachache. Note: The portion sizes are huge!! We usually don't take leftover food from restaurants, but there was a lot left, and the food was so amazing!

I would surely recommend this to anyone in the Divisadero area looking for quick, delicious food.

excerpts: Chow mein, avocado egg rolls, and basil tofu were all excellent.
They are still working out some kinks, but overall, very good food and a great experience.
Definitely coming back - this will be a regular spot for us.
basil tofu.author: Stevan D.
basil tofu.review: Great little neighborhood Chinese restaurant.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Tons of great vegetarian items on the menu.  Vegetables tasted fresh and not too greasy, portions were huge,  prices were very reasonable.  Chow mein, avocado egg rolls, and basil tofu were all excellent.  They are still working out some kinks, but overall, very good food and a great experience.  Definitely coming back - this will be a regular spot for us.

excerpts: Salt and pepper tofu soggy.
salt and pepper tofu.author: Kandle S.
salt and pepper tofu.review: Meat undercooked in pot stickers.  Salt and pepper tofu soggy.

O-M-Yummy!

The beef was tender and very flavorful.
The wontons were crispy, not what I had expected but sooo good!

asparagus in black bean sauce.review: We ordered delivery to quench a craving and try Kung Food for the first time.  We got the Hunan Grilled Butter Beef, Asparagus in Black Bean Sauce, and Wontons. excerpts: Ordered chicken fried rice and sweet and sour pork.
The food came out in a decent amount of time and it was delicious !
The food didn't taste salty , or oily .

Shoutout to the owner Andy !
He gave excellent customer service and you can genuinely tell he cares about customer satisfaction.
Will definitely come back.
sweet and sour pork.author: P L.
sweet and sour pork.review: Came in here 40 minutes before they closed and the owner, Andy , was kind enough to tell us that they're closing in 40 min and to place an order soon so that we'll have enough time to sit down and eat. It's a small nice place and the food was really good ! Ordered chicken fried rice and sweet and sour pork. The food came out in a decent amount of time and it was delicious ! The food didn't taste salty , or oily . It was made just right . Shoutout to the owner Andy ! He gave excellent customer service and you can genuinely tell he cares about customer satisfaction. Will definitely come back.

excerpts: Ok, let's turn it over to the Shredded Pork with Garlic Sauce - generally one of my most favorite menu items.
Nope; here too, the flavor was very off - kinda bitter, no garlic to speak off, and about 80% some kind of shredded vegetable.
shredded pork with garlic sauce.author: Chris S.
shredded pork with garlic sauce.review:
This is my first and only counterexample to my rule of "if yelp rates it 4 stars or better, it's good". I got the General Tso's, which had the "flavor" knob stuck at 1 (but only because they couldn't turn it any lower) - unless you count the flavor of over-fried, over-breaded meat (which was really chewey). Ok, let's turn it over to the Shredded Pork with Garlic Sauce - generally one of my most favorite menu items. Nope; here too, the flavor was very off - kinda bitter, no garlic to speak off, and about 80% some kind of shredded vegetable. At least with that one they did actually make it a little spicy...not as spicy as I requested, but at least something.

I might try the orange chicken one day, but otherwise will not be back.

excerpts: My first visit, I was hungry and ordered the Mongolian lamb over rice.
For $9.95, the spicy dish has lean and grilled lamb meat, spicy peppers, onions and extra heat.
Every lunch specials comes with a complimentary egg roll.
mongolian lamb.author: Matt G.
mongolian lamb.review:
Who would have thought that the NOPA area, McAllister and Divisadero Street to be exact, have a pretty good Chinese restaurant? I certainly didn't think so. But that area has change positively every day. 

I also heard and read on our beloved website, that this restaurant has really good lunch specials. And you thought that I rely heavily on a burrito and an Oscar Mayer bologna sandwich (not all on one serving) for lunch!?! 

I was here last month and twice within a week, both times checking out the lunch specials.  The lunch specials range from $7.50-$9.95. My first visit, I was hungry and ordered the Mongolian lamb over rice. For $9.95, the spicy dish has lean and grilled lamb meat, spicy peppers, onions and extra heat. Every lunch specials comes with a complimentary egg roll. You can also choose white rice, brown or fried rice, both at extra cost.   I like any spicy Mongolian rice dishes, the restaurant's version is very good with the grilled lamb a difference maker. This dish is classified as spicy, but this dish is tolerable for wimps. 

I also ordered a side of chicken wings. The chicken wings were just okay with overly excessive amount of batter. Plus, it was an overkill with the hefty and large rice plate. They say, "my eyes are bigger than my stomach" It definitely shows. But I struggled and finished both dishes anyway. 

My second visit came a few days later. I ordered Dragon beef over rice. For $8.95, the beef was slightly fried with a hint of Hunan-blended spices. The dish is very mild with a tangy taste of Hunan flavor. I also like this dish too. 

The restaurant is really small and is located on the McAllister street side and not the busy Divisadero corridor side. The workers were really nice and treated Joe Cool like a king.

excerpts: My buddy got the mongolian lamb and I got the pan fried noodles with beef.
Service was great too and they heeded my request to go easy on the salt by lessening the sauce poured in.
The owner is super friendly and accomodating.
mongolian lamb.author: Victor C.
mongolian lamb.review:
My buddy and I came here on a Thursday night around 8pm.  No line, that's a definite plus, but that also makes me wonder if the food is any good.  Fortunately, I found out it is.  Food is delicious and well priced.  My buddy got the mongolian lamb and I got the pan fried noodles with beef.  Service was great too and they heeded my request to go easy on the salt by lessening the sauce poured in.  The owner is super friendly and accomodating.  Funny thing is when we left around 9, the place was much livelier and most tables were occupied.  

Good, cheap chinese food without the hole in the wall ambiance.  I highly recommend trying

excerpts: Excelente Mongolian lamb much better w lest crush peppers my calamari very good on flavor and amount of food b to much green bell pepppers

excerpts: I've tried the combination pan fried noodles, hunan chicken, Mongolian lamb, fried rice-- all of which were fantastic.
Highly recommend.
mongolian lamb.author: Roula C.
mongolian lamb.review: So happy to have discovered this place. Family run and the staff is wonderful. Food is fantastic. Portions are so large and prices are great. I've tried the combination pan fried noodles, hunan chicken, Mongolian lamb, fried rice-- all of which were fantastic. Highly recommend.

excerpts: My bestie Grace was in love with the Garlic Lamb and Dry sautéd string Beans, and she was impressed by how profoundly the Chef works with his spices.
We ended up taking 5 huge boxes home with honorable Blue Bag.
I really wish their place was a bit bigger, so we could stretch out!
Good luck Kung Food
garlic lamb.author: Yueqi Z.
garlic lamb.review: This place is by far the cleanest Chinese Restaurant I've been to. According to the owner Andy Yang, that his sister Jamie did the interior design all on her own. Never been to a Chinese restaurant that has the ambiance and atmosphere is similar to an Italian Restaurant. Their General Tsao chicken and Hunan Dragon Beef are real tasty, but the dim sum was just average. To my astonishment that the owner Andy Yang is one of the well known Hip Hop artist in the Chinese community. I have been to many of his performances and concerts. It made me feel so special to be served by this genuine and humble Hip Hop Artist. My bestie Grace was in love with the Garlic Lamb and Dry sautéd string Beans, and she was impressed by how profoundly the Chef works with his spices. We ended up taking 5 huge boxes home with honorable Blue Bag. I really wish their place was a bit bigger, so we could stretch out! Good luck Kung Food

excerpts: For the main entrée, we got the Hunan Crispy Dragon Beef.
It was so delicious that I had dreams about it that night.
For $9.75, the portion was enough to feed like 3 people.
hunan crispy dragon beef.author: Iya J.
hunan crispy dragon beef.review:
I LOVE KUNG FOOD!

I went to Kung Food Saturday night with my boyfriend. My boyfriend lives only a block away from Kung Food and before that, there were no Chinese restaurants in that neighborhood. Not really sure why. We were hesitant to try it at first but one day decided to give it a shot. For appetizers, we got the Korean chicken wings and dim sum combination plate. They were so freaking good. We got our food in less than 10 minutes, including our main entrée.

For the main entrée, we got the Hunan Crispy Dragon Beef. It was so delicious that I had dreams about it that night. For $9.75, the portion was enough to feed like 3 people. We had eaten so much but still had plenty of leftovers for the next day. 

Service was excellent. Andy is so nice and he gives the best customer service ever. He is always smiling and very polite. 

I'd also like to mention that I left my debit card here and when I came back the next day, the cashier gave it to me. I was very impressed with the honesty of the people working here.

Andy, I read your comments regarding the one star reviews you got. I feel you!!! Don't mind the haters as your restaurant will be very successful. 

I cannot wait to go back to this place. I'm pretty sure I will be back this week. =)

excerpts: String Bean Beef was tasty.
Beans were perfectly cooked and very fresh with a fair amount of beef.
It was dry fried, which I like, but the ample garlic was only on half the dish.
string bean beef.author: M M.
string bean beef.review:
I really wanted to like this place but large portions of only ok food doesn't make up for overv an hour and forty five minute wait on delivery.   

String Bean Beef was tasty. Beans were perfectly cooked and very fresh with a fair amount of beef. It was dry fried, which I like, but the ample garlic was only on half the dish. Odd that it wasn't completely stirred through and completely missing red chilis. 

General Tsao's Chicken could have been very good but not this time. The chicken was prepared well with large boneless chunks battered with the skin on then deep fried till nicely crisp. The sauce was the problem. I asked for it medium hot and,  though vinegary, wasn't spicy at all. Certainly needed something to balance the syrupy sweetness. Was also missing broccoli mentioned  on their website menu.

Combination fried rice was ok but nothing special. 

Lots of reviews here are great so maybe they had a bad night. It happens. We'll give Kung Food another shot some time. Just not for a while.

excerpts: We ordered oyster sauce beef, chicken with black bean sauce, fried rice, spring rolls and
everything was delicious.
oyster sauce beef.author: Mary Ann J.
oyster sauce beef.review: Great Chinese Food. I love this place! We ordered oyster sauce beef, chicken with black bean sauce, fried rice, spring rolls and everything was delicious.

Had a pretty good dinner here. Enjoyed the tomato beef chow mein and my friend has the basil chicken.
I can definitely see myself coming here again.
The staff was friendly and attentive. While we were there, several people came in to pick up takeout orders and there was a delivery person in and out a few times as well.

otherwise it's a wait for this 20 seater eatery.

basil beef.author: Michael M.
basil beef.review: What a wonderful find in the McAllister Divisadero area. A much needed Asian restaurant in this quaint neighborhood. I ordered the basil beef with fried rice for lunch. Plenty of beef and stirred fried vegetables to please even the faint of heart. The fried rice was perfectly done not too hard and not too mushy. The lunch comes with an egg roll and a bowl of corn soup. Definitely a gem. Get there early to make sure you get a seat otherwise it's a wait for this 20 seater eatery. The wait staff is very attentive and personable too.

The feeling is
They Care about food and serving a home-made meal.
I will be working my way through their wonderfully varied menu of items.

basil beef.review: Best Chinese delivery. Friendly & helpful. Fresh food. Colorful veggies. Complex flavors in the basil beef.  If food is love this restaurant is my new romance.  There's an almost magical enjoyment about ordering from them.  The feeling is They Care about food and serving a home-made meal.  I will be working my way through their wonderfully varied menu of items.  Thanks for delivering a delightful meal.

excerpts: My Love chose the sweet & sour chicken, and I decided to try the cumin beef, because I hadn't heard of it.
Cumin is a primary ingredient in most curries, and I knew this would have a distinctive, wake-up twist.
As advertised, this was not your classical Chinatown fare.
The names were the same, but the grease was gone.
The cumin beef was billed as a hot dish, and I did find plenty of peppers in it.
cumin beef.author: David D.
cumin beef.review:
What does it all mean?  

Can there be good food, good service, and a good price?  Do you have to choose any 2? 

At 1 pm on a Saturday My Love and I walked in.  It was calm and quiet, unlike the construction up the street, which we hardly heard inside.  It was uncrowded, unlike the southern cafe down the street, where 14 people waited patiently behind crowd control cords.  Casually, we picked an empty table in one of the windows and accepted the staff's immediate attention.  

The room, which seats 20, was decorated in lacquered wood, prosperity cats, and lucky bamboo.  The menu was nicely bound in hardback.  It was time to try the food and see what was up.  

My Love chose the sweet & sour chicken, and I decided to try the cumin beef, because I hadn't heard of it.  Cumin is a primary ingredient in most curries, and I knew this would have a distinctive, wake-up twist.  As advertised, this was not your classical Chinatown fare.  The names were the same, but the grease was gone.  The cumin beef was billed as a hot dish, and I did find plenty of peppers in it.  I managed to keep the heat down to something my tongue could cope with by setting the peppers aside, but it was still tasty and it still gave my mouth a buzz.  

Included with the main dish were sweet & sour soup, steamed rice, an egg roll, tea, and a fortune cookie.  Seriously.  A fortune cookie.  

Somewhere in the middle of the lunch I decided to order a diet Coke, which helped me manage the heat of the main dish.  

All of it was great!  The attentive waitstaff was great!  Not hearing the construction outside was great!  Watching people on the sidewalk, as they peered through the window to see what this place was like, was great! 

I was thrilled with the food and service.  Anxiously I anticipated the check.  Would it be $60? $70?  But no, it was just $18 + tip!  For 2 giant delicious lunches!  That's great! 

So the answer is you can have it all!  We took a menu home (they deliver, which is great!), and we will return.

excerpts: My wife and I ordered the Black Pepper Steak.
The steak was amazingly flavorful, cooked to a masterful perfection of medium rare tenderness.
Chinese people can be very serious about the selection of prime cuts and how steak is done!!
We also ordered this meatless dish (String Bean with Meatless Prawn) to see how this restaurant accommodated to the needs of vegetarians.
Simply amazing; even an infamous carnivore such as myself finished all the string beans.
black pepper steak.author: Justin H.
black pepper steak.review:
Mesmerized by this new Hole-in-the-Wall foodie spot. Not only is the owner an amateur Chinese rapper who serves amazing Chinese food, this restaurant plays some pretty neat contemporary hiphop Chinese music.  

My wife and I ordered the Black Pepper Steak. The steak was amazingly flavorful, cooked to a masterful perfection of medium rare tenderness. Chinese people can be very serious about the selection of prime cuts and how steak is done!! We also ordered this meatless dish (String Bean with Meatless Prawn) to see how this restaurant accommodated to the needs of vegetarians. Simply amazing; even an infamous carnivore such as myself finished all the string beans. The vegan prawn tasted like prawn despite being made from flour (no pun intended).  

Finally the owner greeted our table in a very cordial manner and introduced himself.  He explained how it took him nearly three years to realize his dream of opening his very own restaurant, and that he has two passions in life--food and music. This restaurant is a paradigm example of one of those hole-in- the-wall restaurants dispersed throughout SF. This genre of owners have other passions in life besides unscrupulously operating their businesses to maximize profits and $$$$. I believe when one operates a business out of passion and in pursuit of other dreams in life, the products and services are always exceptionally remarkable. Kung Food is clearly different from large chain restaurants that only want your $$$$.

Once in a rare blue moon, I experienced the warmth of dining as a welcomed and cherished patron. People always talk about one of those renowned hole-in-the-wall Italian Restaurants in SF and its unusually hospitable owner. Well now we have a new Chinese version of such a restaurant. No question, this restaurant fully deserves the full 5-star rating.

excerpts: I have been try couples dishes, like Basil lab, chicken wings, garlic spinach, garlic beef and beef with scramble egg.
Most of them are very good and tasty.
The services are good and friendly as well.
Will recommend to my friends.
beef with scramble egg.author: Lisa Y.
beef with scramble egg.review: This is a great place to eat! I usually go there with my friends and boyfriend. I have been try couples dishes, like Basil lab, chicken wings, garlic spinach, garlic beef and beef with scramble egg. Most of them are very good and tasty.The services are good and friendly as well. Will recommend to my friends.

excerpts: Got the mango chicken, which is so much food, I will definitely be eating it for two meals!
mango chicken.author: Shendi X.
mango chicken.review:
I've been here a few times for dinner, and am definitely a fan! Happened to take a look at the lunch specials, and I was immediately interested. :p

Got the mango chicken, which is so much food, I will definitely be eating it for two meals! The complimentary soup and egg roll are also a nice touch, and of appropriate sizes, IMO.

So. Much. Food. And. So. Yum!

excerpts: My favorite dish there is Mango chicken.
mango chicken.author: Shihomi K.
mango chicken.review:
If you are looking for so called 'authentic Chinese style Chinese dishes', don't go here. This place is more American style Chinese restaurant, which I often craving for after the hard work.

The space is relatively small, but it's worth to wait if you are very hungry because their portion is really huge! If you are two hungry couple, order one entree, one dimsum, and two bowls of rice would be more than enough.

My favorite dish there is Mango chicken.

excerpts: Mango chicken is good and spicy.
The Spicy calamari roll thing (I do not know the name).
Everything we had a good.
It's a quaint place with great, relaxed service.
We will be back.
Thanks again Kung Food!
mango chicken.author: Shayna C.
mango chicken.review: A-mazing!! Mango chicken is good and spicy. The Spicy calamari roll thing (I do not know the name). Everything we had a good. It's a quaint place with great, relaxed service. We will be back. Thanks again Kung Food!

excerpts: My daughter and son-in-law had mango chicken and mango prawns.
The vegetables were crisp and the sauce had just the right amount of spice.
I had mushu pork
and it was the best I've had in years.
The pancakes were thin, as they should be, but held together well.
My husband had king pao chicken and this was the only disappointing dish.
We both wish the ingredients had been cut up into smaller pieces as no knives were provided and both the vegetables and the chicken  pieces were very large.
mango chicken.author: Dorothy P.
mango chicken.review: Cozy atmosphere and good food.  We dropped into this neighborhood spot for dinner at 8 pm and were delighted to be served fresh and delicious dinners. My daughter and son-in-law had mango chicken and mango prawns. The vegetables were crisp and the sauce had just the right amount of spice. I had mushu pork and it was the best I've had in years. The pancakes were thin, as they should be, but held together well. My husband had king pao chicken and this was the only disappointing dish. We both wish the ingredients had been cut up into smaller pieces as no knives were provided and both the vegetables and the chicken  pieces were very large.

excerpts: Mongolian chicken was excellent
mongolian chicken.author: Patti B.
mongolian chicken.review: What a fun place to go eat in the city. Super yummy food and the service was great! Mongolian chicken was excellent

excerpts: We ordered the chicken fried rice and the Hunan chicken.
The fried rice was great -- classic and nothing too fancy.
I wouldn't recommend the Hunan chicken; it came with a lot of sauce but nothing too distinguishing in flavor, and a random assortment of vegetables which wasn't too appealing to me.
hunan chicken.author: Kelsey P.
hunan chicken.review:
Kung Food is a good, no-fuss Chinese restaurant.  When I'm looking for Chinese restaurants, all I really care about are two things: quality of food, speed, and price, and Kung Food hits all of those three.

The restaurant itself isn't too large, but when we came around 5pm on a Sunday, we ordered and got our food within 10 minutes.  As with most Chinese restaurants, the menu is pretty extensive, which means that there are some great items, but also some worth avoiding.  We ordered the chicken fried rice and the Hunan chicken.  The fried rice was great -- classic and nothing too fancy.  I wouldn't recommend the Hunan chicken; it came with a lot of sauce but nothing too distinguishing in flavor, and a random assortment of vegetables which wasn't too appealing to me.  Still, looking at some of the other dishes at nearby tables that looked delicious, I think we just made a bad call on ordering it.

Overall, good Chinese restaurant and probably will become my go-to takeout place in the area.

excerpts: I had Hunan Chicken, my husband had
The Hunan Chicken had generous pieces of chicken breast.
hunan chicken.author: Cynthia F.
hunan chicken.review:
My cousin took me and my husband to Kung Food. I love Hunan cuisine and this place, I thought, is just the right place.  I was not disappointed. For appetizers, we ordered Fried Calamari and Shanghai Style Dumplings. Sweet and Sour Soup and Fried Egg Rolls were complementary. I had Hunan Chicken, my husband had Mongolian Beef & my cousin had custom made non spicy stir fried all beef with egg noodles.

The menu has salad selections and various healthy menu options. The sauces were very good, not too spicy. The Hunan Chicken had generous pieces of chicken breast. The food is neither salty nor was it greasy and, it is reasonably priced!

We will definitely come back to try the Korean Spicy Wings, Green Onion Pancakes & Green Beans from the vegetarian selections.

excerpts: I've tried the combination pan fried noodles, hunan chicken, Mongolian lamb, fried rice-- all of which were fantastic.
Highly recommend.
hunan chicken.author: Roula C.
hunan chicken.review: So happy to have discovered this place. Family run and the staff is wonderful. Food is fantastic. Portions are so large and prices are great. I've tried the combination pan fried noodles, hunan chicken, Mongolian lamb, fried rice-- all of which were fantastic. Highly recommend.

excerpts: Today I ordered walnut prawns and there were THREE walnuts.
Also the egg fried rice that was $1 extra was completely without flavor.
You'd think after so many visits I'd finally get the clue and stop going, but I'm still hopeful that after so many years they'll improve.
walnut prawns.author: D C.
walnut prawns.review:
Ugh. I REALLY want to like this place because it's family owned, affordable and is the only Chinese in our neighborhood.
I have gone here half a dozen times and each time there is something glaringly wrong.
First off, not knowing how to make Egg Foo Yung is unacceptable if you offer it on your menu.
Having gummy wontons in wonton soup is also not ok.
Today I ordered walnut prawns and there were THREE walnuts. Also the egg fried rice that was $1 extra was completely without flavor.
You'd think after so many visits I'd finally get the clue and stop going, but I'm still hopeful that after so many years they'll improve.

excerpts: Honey Walnut Prawns -
These babies are so juicy and plump, they pop in your mouth.
The sauce is creamy, slightly sweet, and savory, yet not heavily doused in oil.
walnut prawns.author: Ann S.
walnut prawns.review:
The literal translation for Kung Fu is time spent at skillful work. Change the U to a double O and a D to create the words Kung Food? Oh it's a done deal. The Shaolin monks, themselves, would approve of such mastery. 

First of all, Chinese takeout is usually pretty greasy, laden with MSG, and not of the greatest quality; however, it fills the belly and it's cheap. 

Here at Kung Food, you get the freshest ingredients AND affordability. 

I highly recommend their lunch specials. You get an entree with a side of steamed white rice or for an extra dollar you can opt for egg fried rice, veggie chow mein, or brown rice. Soup and an egg roll are also included for free. All of this for $8.50. 

Entrees that I've tried here thus far:

Mongolian Beef - tender slices of beef sautéed with bell peppers and green onions along with whole red chili peppers. This dish is especially good because the sauce is not overpowering and the meat is cooked to perfection. The veggies are not served limp, and they remain crisp and light with every bite. 

Curry Chicken - I ordered this as spicy, and it came out surprisingly balanced. The cuts of chicken were moist and the curry flavor was prominent without being overwhelming. 

Honey Walnut Prawns - These babies are so juicy and plump, they pop in your mouth. The sauce is creamy, slightly sweet, and savory, yet not heavily doused in oil. The candied walnuts dusted with sesame seeds played a supportive role in rounding out this dish. 

Orange Chicken - Citrusy with a hint of tangy and a touch of sweetness, I was relieved to see that this common dish was not over-fried and dry.  

Kung Food promises outstanding Chinese cuisine, excellent service, and friendly staff; all of which I have personally experienced and can vouch for. 

When it comes to cheap, Chinese takeout, I thing Kung Food is definitely a game changer in the definition of how this food can be perceived. 

5 Stars!

excerpts: The walnut prawns was not bad.
But remember what I said about the location?
Take a walk down to Wonderland and you will find much better walnut prawns.
The Hunan tofu was decent, probably the best dish we got.
The Yang Chow fried rice was so-so.
walnut prawns.author: S K.
walnut prawns.review:
If this is the only Chinese place within miles, I would probably give it a begrudging pass. But this is in the city with the oldest Chinatown in the US, the bar must be set much higher.
This is a review of the delivery service.
When we placed the order, the delivery time was 45-60 minutes. We did not get our order for 1:45. This is already a big no-no. The restaurant did not call to let us know the delay.
One of the menu items was the dimsum combination plate. It says on the menu that it includes 2 of each of the items, shrimp dumplings, pork buns and siu mai. So we were expecting 2 shrimp dumplings, 2 pork buns, and 2 siu mai. Imagine our surprise when we found 4 shrimp dumplings, 2 siu mai, and no pork buns! Another big no-no!

Let's not even take into consideration that if this is take-out food, you will probably want utensils. None was to be found!

OK, now let's get into the food itself. The dimsum was just OK, our expectations completely ruined by the discrepancy in the actual items.
The walnut prawns was not bad. But remember what I said about the location? Take a walk down to Wonderland and you will find much better walnut prawns.
The Hunan tofu was decent, probably the best dish we got. The Yang Chow fried rice was so-so. Again, I've had better, probably Red Jade.

Overall, I think if I rate the food itself, it's probably 3.5 stars. But the service was definitely subpar. Remember, this is San Francisco, competition is going to be stiff at best.
We will probably not get food from here again.

excerpts: Honey walnut prawns are a crowd pleaser.
walnut prawns.author: Brett H.
walnut prawns.review:
Andy spits hot fire, he cooks hot food, and that's that.  Legitimately one of the best around.  Great atmosphere.  Honey walnut prawns are a crowd pleaser.

Ask Andy to get on the microphone if you know what's good for you.

excerpts: I had the General Tso's chicken and walnut prawns and they were as good as people say (Imo).
walnut prawns.author: Allyson J.
walnut prawns.review:
Sometimes, when the going gets tough, the tough gets American Chinese food delivered to their home as comfort food.

Kung Food has been a reliable choice for me since I moved out here to SF. I had the General Tso's chicken and walnut prawns and they were as good as people say (Imo).

Just a note, however. Make sure to order steamed rice as the entrees don't come with them. They are $1.50 each.

excerpts: Try the walnut prawns
walnut prawns.author: Johan H.
walnut prawns.review:
This is my favorite place to get food. Nice people are working there and the food is awesome. 
Try the walnut prawns

excerpts: Chicken Chow Mein, Walnut Prawns, Egg Rolls, Pot Stickers, Broccoli Beef...
walnut prawns.author: Rachel G.
walnut prawns.review:
I have never had a bad experience with the food here. Eat in, Pick Up, or Delivery - this place has the Freshest and Most non soggy, greasy Chinese food I have ever had in SF !! 

Chicken Chow Mein, Walnut Prawns, Egg Rolls, Pot Stickers, Broccoli Beef...doesn't matter what you order, it's the Bomb ALWAYS !!!  

They aren't open on Mondays, so order 2 days worth of food on Sunday, or Literally STARVE yourself Till Tuesday when you have the chance to order !! Totes worth it.

excerpts: and I shared the honey walnut prawns, roast duck, and string beans with lamb.
walnut prawns.author: Abby S.
walnut prawns.review:
Food (4/5): I've been here a couple times now, and both times I really enjoyed the food. Last time my bf and I shared the honey walnut prawns, roast duck, and string beans with lamb. Everything was really flavorful and well prepared, and I would definitely order any of those dishes again.

Service (5/5): The owner is so nice! He always keeps your water/tea filled, which is a huge plus for me haha. He also accommodated our friend who came later just to hang out - even though our friend didn't order anything, the owner still brought him a chair, tea, and a fortune cookie at the end of the meal. 

Value (5/5): Portions are huge. Dishes are meant to be family style, so I'd recommend getting at least two to try out - if you get rice on the side, you'll definitely have enough for dinner. The three dishes plus a bowl of rice lasted me and my bf for two meals for $44 total, and we were stuffed.

This place also does takeout! Most customers we saw were just in to pick up their orders.

excerpts: I got the walnut prawns and hot and sour soup- DELICIOUS!
walnut prawns.author: Joseph A.
walnut prawns.review: Sooooooo good! They're salty fish and chicken fried rice is bomb. I took that for take out. I went on Valentine's Day too. I got the walnut prawns and hot and sour soup- DELICIOUS!

excerpts: The Hunan Buttered Beef was tender, the Walnut Prawns were unique and tasty.
For me, the fried rice is the test of a good Chinese restaurant, and this is good fried rice.
The food is good, inexpensive and the service is friendly and quick.
walnut prawns.author: Chris P.
walnut prawns.review:
My wife and I were on vacation in San Francisco and wanted an easy take-away meal, I had my mind set on Chinese food. This place was close to our apartment and highly rated on yelp so we took a chance and ordered. It took me about 20 minutes to walk there and it was ready when I arrived.

The Hunan Buttered Beef was tender, the Walnut Prawns were unique and tasty. For me, the fried rice is the test of a good Chinese restaurant, and this is good fried rice. The food is good, inexpensive and the service is friendly and quick. Be warned, it is only a very small restaurant with about 6 tables that I saw.

Recommended.

excerpts: We got the cumin lamb, rock cod fillet in black bean sauce, sauteed string beans, korean chicken wings, and crab rangoon.
My favorite was the rock cod - the flavor was really delicate and the bean sauce wasn't overpowering.
The string beans were great - not overlooked and still crunchy.
The cumin lamb was flavorful, but could have used more cumin (just my personal preference for cumin).
The chicken wings were hot and crispy, and a little sweet.
And the crab rangoon was surprisingly good, with real crab bits.
Note that the space is tiny - it probably seats about 25 people, so anticipate a wait for dinner time on a weekend.
And as everyone has said, the owner is super nice and friendly.
rock cod fillet in black bean sauce.author: E. C. P.
rock cod fillet in black bean sauce.review: I have to be honest - I don't really like Chinese food. And I'm Chinese. However, I did like Kung Food. We got the cumin lamb, rock cod fillet in black bean sauce, sauteed string beans, korean chicken wings, and crab rangoon. My favorite was the rock cod - the flavor was really delicate and the bean sauce wasn't overpowering. The string beans were great - not overlooked and still crunchy. The cumin lamb was flavorful, but could have used more cumin (just my personal preference for cumin). The chicken wings were hot and crispy, and a little sweet. And the crab rangoon was surprisingly good, with real crab bits. Note that the space is tiny - it probably seats about 25 people, so anticipate a wait for dinner time on a weekend. And as everyone has said, the owner is super nice and friendly.

excerpts: Dry fried long beans, Lemon prawns and Eggplant with Chicken and Prawns were all tasty without being overly heavy.
I am enjoying traipsing through their lunch menu.
lemon prawns.author: Donald C.
lemon prawns.review:
I am a big fan of this place. It fills a gaping hole in the available options around Divis, and the food is very solid for the price. Simple solid Chinese food; the dude serving it is not twirling a waxed mustachio for better or for worse.

Dry fried long beans, Lemon prawns and Eggplant with Chicken and Prawns were all tasty without being overly heavy. I am enjoying traipsing through their lunch menu.

excerpts: I definitely plan to go back soon, and when I do, I think I'm going for the General Tso or the Lemon Meatless Chicken.
I'll let you know ;-)
lemon meatless chicken.author: Kelly L.
lemon meatless chicken.review:
This place is great for vegetarians and vegans! The ingredients are listed on the menu to assure you that certain dishes do not contain any animal products. Additionally, the portions are huge, so you can easily squeak two meals out of one entree. 

For an appetizer, my boyfriend and I got the vegetable spring rolls. Pretty simple: shredded cabbage and carrots, but the dipping sauce (a sweet chili sauce?) was amazing.  For an entree, I ordered the Sesame Meatless Chicken with Broccoli, which was so yum. My boyfriend had the Kung Pao Meatless Prawns, which was also very good. It came with lots of sauteed veggies (peppers and onions) in a light sauce. The meatless prawns looked like actual prawns, which always freaks me out since I've never eaten seafood, but they were really good nonetheless. I'm really impressed that this restaurant decided to offer something other than tofu or meatless chicken. 

I don't think they have any vegan options for dessert, but you do get unlimited hot tea with your meal, which was a nice bonus.

I definitely plan to go back soon, and when I do, I think I'm going for the General Tso or the Lemon Meatless Chicken. I'll let you know ;-)

excerpts: We loved their sweet and sour meatless chicken and the kung pow meatless chicken.
I saw that some have complained about the texture of the meatless chicken, I don't what they are complaining about.
Three of us were vegetarians and we loved the texture and flavor.
We also had the vegetarian pot stickers, which were delicious and a good size.
sweet and sour meatless chicken.author: Adrian N.
sweet and sour meatless chicken.review:
Their meatless chicken dishes were so good ! We loved their sweet and sour meatless chicken and the kung pow meatless chicken. I saw that some have complained about the texture of the meatless chicken, I don't what they are complaining about. Three of us were vegetarians and we loved the texture and flavor. We also had the vegetarian pot stickers, which were delicious and a good size. I highly recommend for vegetarians. 

Also note: the sizes are large, we had plenty of leftovers

excerpts: For an entree, I ordered the Sesame Meatless Chicken with Broccoli, which was so yum.
sesame meatless chicken.author: Kelly L.
