excerpts:
like most, i ordered my litmus test chinese food...in my case: kung pao chicken (spicy) and vegetable mu shu...

delivery was speedy...like half the time anticipated, so i'll give them that.
vegetable mu shu.author: Wendy X.
vegetable mu shu.review:
I really wanted to like this place... really... 

like most, i ordered my litmus test chinese food...in my case: kung pao chicken (spicy) and vegetable mu shu...

delivery was speedy...like half the time anticipated, so i'll give them that. alright! we're off to a good start! I opened the kung pao, and it looked healthy. The chicken was cut into flattened non-bite-sized pieces and there were hardly any peanuts, there was, however an astounding amount of (red) onions and (green) peppers. I literally think there was an entire red onion in this item, and btw, kung pao doesn't typically even have red onion...I picked out all of the onion (after a first serving not doing so and getting onion in every damn bite), and the green peppers which i don't like to begin with but wanted to see how the kung pao would come without any special ordering. By the time I'd picked out all the remaining onions and the green peppers, it filled HALF of the container it came in. Therefore, i paid almost 10bucks for onions and peppers. Also, the spicy could have been kicked up a notch. I dared not order extra spicy having never ordered from them before, but I'd advise the "extra spicy"if you are going to order from here and want some spice :)

The mu shu was okay, but showed up cold despite the quick delivery. 

I wish I could recommend kung food, but i can't

Guess I'm still on the hunt for good chinese food delivery. I still miss ha's!

excerpts: The pork fried rice was bland.
The lemon chicken was over cooked.
Perhaps the time I spent in China eating fresh Chinese ruined my palate for average Chinese.
pork fried rice.author: Peppermint N.
pork fried rice.review: Meh.  Large portions but not particularly great food.  The food came out very very fast, like it was microwaved or already waiting. The pork fried rice was bland.   The lemon chicken was over cooked. Perhaps the time I spent in China eating fresh Chinese ruined my palate for average Chinese.

excerpts: We had the orange chicken, curry beef & fried tofu, pork fried rice, and veggie chow fun.
It was all DELICIOUS.
We had a water pitcher that was always refilled in a timely manner (which is so nice since some restaurants let you go thirsty) and a tea pot that was refilled with hot water when needed.
Overall this was so yummy
and I'll definitely come back
pork fried rice.author: Ryan Q.
pork fried rice.review: This was a wonderful meal with great service! We had the orange chicken, curry beef & fried tofu, pork fried rice, and veggie chow fun. It was all DELICIOUS. We had a water pitcher that was always refilled in a timely manner (which is so nice since some restaurants let you go thirsty) and a tea pot that was refilled with hot water when needed. Overall this was so yummy and I'll definitely come back

excerpts: I had ordered for delivery the pork fried rice, hot and sour soup and steamed vegetable dumplings.
The delivery was fast and the food was hot.
However, the dumplings were not tasty, they were doughy and bland.
The soup had a bit too much sour and not enough hot while the fried rice was dry and missing a lacking  in egg, vegetables and pork.
Skimpy comes to mind.
I love Chinese food and would try Kung again, but if any other alternative is available I would choose that first.
pork fried rice.author: Elias W.
pork fried rice.review: I had ordered for delivery the pork fried rice, hot and sour soup and steamed vegetable dumplings.   The delivery was fast and the food was hot.  However, the dumplings were not tasty, they were doughy and bland.  The soup had a bit too much sour and not enough hot while the fried rice was dry and missing a lacking  in egg, vegetables and pork.  Skimpy comes to mind.   I love Chinese food and would try Kung again, but if any other alternative is available I would choose that first.

excerpts: The pork fried rice was a real treat too.
pork fried rice.author: Ronald B.
pork fried rice.review:
Finally found a place that has pretty good Chinese Food.  Recently came to Kung Food and ordered the Sesame Chicken.  It was divine!  Just the right amount of sweetness, and the perfect amount of crunch.  The pork fried rice was a real treat too.  

Service was quick and the restaurant was nice and clean.  The staff was nice and friendly.  I would say that I will happily come back.   Looking forward to trying more delicious food.

excerpts: we ordered bbq pork fried rice..sweet n sour pork..chicken chow mein..
Mongolian beef n potstickers..we liked the potstickers..we usually finish the food but not this time around..
pork fried rice.author: Jo S.
pork fried rice.review: Wanted to try out this place from reading the reviews..sorry folks but not for me..the food here  was not as good as some of the places that I have eaten before..the people are friendly, and the service was good..hence the 3 stars ..but the food was just average we ordered bbq pork fried rice..sweet n sour pork..chicken chow mein..Mongolian beef n potstickers..we liked the potstickers..we usually finish the food but not this time around..

excerpts: My other go tos are the BBQ pork fried rice, Generals chicken, Mongolian beef, and Hot & Sour soup.
Nothing disappointed!
pork fried rice.author: Jenee Y.
pork fried rice.review:
I've been to this place twice since they opened down the street from where I live and the food is delicious. 

The portions here are very generous and our server, who I believe to be the son of the family that owns the restaurant, was very friendly and informative. He recommended a special that I believe was called the butter beef: tender sautéed filet mignon with greens and scallion, this dish blew my mind. My other go tos are the BBQ pork fried rice, Generals chicken, Mongolian beef, and Hot & Sour soup. Nothing disappointed!

excerpts: We ordered the Hunan Butter Beef (my #1), Chicken Lo Mein (HUGE chunks of chicken and delicious), Lemon Chicken (#2 favorite), beef & broccoli (my kids favorite) and we got a free pork fried rice.
Seriously the best Chinese food I've had in a while.
My husband said the owners were locals which makes me love this place more - I want to support my hometown peeps!
Delivery was swift and I am still dreaming of the food.
pork fried rice.author: stephany m.
pork fried rice.review: This is my new GO TO CHINESE FOOD FOR DELIVERY!!!  You can tell that they use fresh ingredients & don't go super heavy on the oil.  We ordered the Hunan Butter Beef (my #1), Chicken Lo Mein (HUGE chunks of chicken and delicious), Lemon Chicken (#2 favorite), beef & broccoli (my kids favorite) and we got a free pork fried rice.  Seriously the best Chinese food I've had in a while.  My husband said the owners were locals which makes me love this place more - I want to support my hometown peeps!  Delivery was swift and I am still dreaming of the food.

excerpts: we got pan fried noodles chicken, Chinese beef and broccoli, pork fried rice and general tsao's
chicken - got the fried rice for free.
Fed the two of us all weekend.
Quality was great and my tummy was happy.
pork fried rice.author: Victoria K.
pork fried rice.review: First time ordering and we got delivery on a Friday night. Don't judge. They said it was an hour wait which was fine because we expected it/weren't that hungry. Boom - 20 minutes later our doorbell rings. WTF?! Open it up (well, the boyfriend does) and the delivery guy APOLOGIZES for how long it took. What they say about the buy 3 get one free thing is real - we got pan fried noodles chicken, Chinese beef and broccoli, pork fried rice and general tsao's chicken - got the fried rice for free. Fed the two of us all weekend. Quality was great and my tummy was happy.

excerpts: We had the pork fried rice (add pineapple in it)
and it was so good.
Not too salty and perfectly cooked.
The dragon human beef was AMAZING!
It had a little kick to it
but if you don't like spice you can handle this (I promise).
You can also add broccoli to it which made it more colorful and healthier.
The hot spicy homemade pickled sauce is probably the best spicy topping I've ever had in my life.
I can't wait to come back here next time I am in the area!
Thanks
Andy - you rock and good luck with everything :)
pork fried rice.author: Deanna M.
pork fried rice.review: I am visiting here from the NJ/ NY area, and I am so happy I came across this place! First off, the service is excellent. It is a family owned restaurant that has been in business for exactly one year. All of the siblings work here but the main owner is Andy. He is a sweetheart! He was quick to say yes to any requests we had, he was friendly and very personable. He cared about our experience at the restaurant which makes it even better. The food was also amazing! We had the pork fried rice (add pineapple in it) and it was so good. Not too salty and perfectly cooked. The dragon human beef was AMAZING! It had a little kick to it but if you don't like spice you can handle this (I promise). You can also add broccoli to it which made it more colorful and healthier. The hot spicy homemade pickled sauce is probably the best spicy topping I've ever had in my life. I can't wait to come back here next time I am in the area! Thanks Andy - you rock and good luck with everything :)

excerpts: The beef chow mein is a personal fave.
beef chow mein.author: Jaclyn L.
beef chow mein.review:
My absolute FAVORITE in the city! I always come here when I'm in Divisadero. The staff is super friendly and the food is AMAZING. Not to mention they're quick with getting it out. The beef chow mein is a personal fave. Usually, Chinese restaurants can be a little intimidating, especially when you're ordering, but the staff here never makes you feel awkward. 

Environment: 10
Staff: 10
Food: 11

excerpts: I ordered Tomato Beef Chow Mein I will say it is very good.
My co-workers ordered the Spring Rolls.
Nice and crispy.
Sweet and Sour Chicken and Chow
mein lunch special.
Very good and plenty of meat.
beef chow mein.author: Rebecca M.
beef chow mein.review:
First time here! I Yelped Chinese Food in the area. This place came up and I am so glad I tried them out. Inside of restaurant is small and very clean.
Food was fresh and hot.
I ordered Tomato Beef Chow Mein I will say it is very good.
My co-workers ordered the Spring Rolls. Nice and crispy.
Sweet and Sour Chicken and Chow mein lunch special. Very good and plenty of meat.

excerpts: Enjoyed the tomato beef chow mein and my friend has the basil chicken.
I can definitely see myself coming here again.
The staff was friendly and attentive.
While we were there, several people came in to pick up takeout orders and there was a delivery person in and out a few times as well.
beef chow mein.author: Rachel M.
beef chow mein.review:
Had a pretty good dinner here. Enjoyed the tomato beef chow mein and my friend has the basil chicken.
I can definitely see myself coming here again.
The staff was friendly and attentive. While we were there, several people came in to pick up takeout orders and there was a delivery person in and out a few times as well.

excerpts: The beef chow mein  wasn't too greasy and the noodles were cooked perfectly.
The sesame chicken was nice and juicy with big pieces of chicken.
Pot stickers, spring rolls, chicken wings and crab rangoons full of chunks of crab and minimal to non existant cream cheese are all highly recommended.
beef chow mein.author: Rose S.
beef chow mein.review: This place is great! FINALLY an inexpensive delicious chinese food place in the neighborhood! The staff was warm, inviting and was very attentive. The restaurant was nice and clean.  The food was very delicious. If you like San Tung chicken wings then you will enjoy the Korean Chicken Wings. The beef chow mein  wasn't too greasy and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The sesame chicken was nice and juicy with big pieces of chicken. Pot stickers, spring rolls, chicken wings and crab rangoons full of chunks of crab and minimal to non existant cream cheese are all highly recommended. Its nice to find a place that really knows how to make a tasty crab rangoon. I definitely recommend this place and will be going back soon.  I think I might become a regular.

excerpts:
Pineapple shrimp fried rice 
Pork chow mein (free with 2 entrees)
pork chow mein.author: Armen M.
pork chow mein.review:
I've died and gone to heaven. This place is  just nuts. Cozy family owned spot with hospitality to match! 

Oh and the food is outrageous fresh and good. 

pound for pound the best value in SF. 

Hunan butter beef
Black bean asparagus and bok Choi
Pineapple shrimp fried rice 
Pork chow mein (free with 2 entrees)
Shanghai dumplings
$40

And enough to feed 2-3 hungry hippos for dinner and then lunch the next day. 

Bourdain needs to come here!

Thank you Andy and Uncle!!!!

excerpts: Ordered a chicken salad and pork chow mein for to go.
The chicken salad was not what I was expecting at all, and was covered with a pink mayonaise type goop.
It was so nasty looking I threw the entire box straight into the garbage.
The pork chow mein was also gross.
Raw red onion.
That's just not right.
Also, loads of undercooked semi-raw bits of garlic.
pork chow mein.author: Zach S.
pork chow mein.review:
Gross!  Ordered a chicken salad and pork chow mein for to go.  The chicken salad was not what I was expecting at all, and was covered with a pink mayonaise type goop.  It was so nasty looking I threw the entire box straight into the garbage.  Maybe it was delicious, but it looked like vomit.

The pork chow mein was also gross.  Raw red onion.  That's just not right.  Also, loads of undercooked semi-raw bits of garlic.  And the bbq pork was grey and tired.  

These good reviews are very misleading.  This food was straight up nasty in my opinion.  I hate to write a bad review, but I saw all these good reviews and thought I'd give it a try.

excerpts: Ordered a dish of pork chow mein and the Hanan Crispy Beef (a lot like Panda's Mongolian Beef but better!)
for a final bill of about $18.
Food came out quickly and we definitely had leftovers as the two dishes could have fed 3 people.
Bonus, they offer to go orders if you call in and will deliver for free.
Definitely, will be back.
pork chow mein.author: Tim T.
pork chow mein.review: New addition to the NOPA neighborhood. It's tasty, affordable, and has HUGE portions. Ordered a dish of pork chow mein and the Hanan Crispy Beef (a lot like Panda's Mongolian Beef but better!) for a final bill of about $18.  Food came out quickly and we definitely had leftovers as the two dishes could have fed 3 people. Bonus, they offer to go orders if you call in and will deliver for free.  Definitely, will be back.

excerpts: You can also choose white rice, brown or fried rice, both at extra cost.
I like any spicy Mongolian rice dishes, the restaurant's version is very good with the grilled lamb a difference maker.
white rice.author: Matt G.
white rice.review:
Who would have thought that the NOPA area, McAllister and Divisadero Street to be exact, have a pretty good Chinese restaurant? I certainly didn't think so. But that area has change positively every day. 

I also heard and read on our beloved website, that this restaurant has really good lunch specials. And you thought that I rely heavily on a burrito and an Oscar Mayer bologna sandwich (not all on one serving) for lunch!?! 

I was here last month and twice within a week, both times checking out the lunch specials.  The lunch specials range from $7.50-$9.95. My first visit, I was hungry and ordered the Mongolian lamb over rice. For $9.95, the spicy dish has lean and grilled lamb meat, spicy peppers, onions and extra heat. Every lunch specials comes with a complimentary egg roll. You can also choose white rice, brown or fried rice, both at extra cost.   I like any spicy Mongolian rice dishes, the restaurant's version is very good with the grilled lamb a difference maker. This dish is classified as spicy, but this dish is tolerable for wimps. 

I also ordered a side of chicken wings. The chicken wings were just okay with overly excessive amount of batter. Plus, it was an overkill with the hefty and large rice plate. They say, "my eyes are bigger than my stomach" It definitely shows. But I struggled and finished both dishes anyway. 

My second visit came a few days later. I ordered Dragon beef over rice. For $8.95, the beef was slightly fried with a hint of Hunan-blended spices. The dish is very mild with a tangy taste of Hunan flavor. I also like this dish too. 

The restaurant is really small and is located on the McAllister street side and not the busy Divisadero corridor side. The workers were really nice and treated Joe Cool like a king.

excerpts: You get an entree with a side of steamed white rice or for an extra dollar you can opt for egg fried rice, veggie chow mein, or brown rice.
Soup and an egg roll are also included for free.
white rice.author: Ann S.
white rice.review:
The literal translation for Kung Fu is time spent at skillful work. Change the U to a double O and a D to create the words Kung Food? Oh it's a done deal. The Shaolin monks, themselves, would approve of such mastery. 

First of all, Chinese takeout is usually pretty greasy, laden with MSG, and not of the greatest quality; however, it fills the belly and it's cheap. 

Here at Kung Food, you get the freshest ingredients AND affordability. 

I highly recommend their lunch specials. You get an entree with a side of steamed white rice or for an extra dollar you can opt for egg fried rice, veggie chow mein, or brown rice. Soup and an egg roll are also included for free. All of this for $8.50. 

Entrees that I've tried here thus far:

Mongolian Beef - tender slices of beef sautéed with bell peppers and green onions along with whole red chili peppers. This dish is especially good because the sauce is not overpowering and the meat is cooked to perfection. The veggies are not served limp, and they remain crisp and light with every bite. 

Curry Chicken - I ordered this as spicy, and it came out surprisingly balanced. The cuts of chicken were moist and the curry flavor was prominent without being overwhelming. 

Honey Walnut Prawns - These babies are so juicy and plump, they pop in your mouth. The sauce is creamy, slightly sweet, and savory, yet not heavily doused in oil. The candied walnuts dusted with sesame seeds played a supportive role in rounding out this dish. 

Orange Chicken - Citrusy with a hint of tangy and a touch of sweetness, I was relieved to see that this common dish was not over-fried and dry.  

Kung Food promises outstanding Chinese cuisine, excellent service, and friendly staff; all of which I have personally experienced and can vouch for. 

When it comes to cheap, Chinese takeout, I thing Kung Food is definitely a game changer in the definition of how this food can be perceived. 

5 Stars!

excerpts: I ordered the Korean fried chicken lunch meal and it came with white rice, hot & sour soup and egg roll.
The fried chicken was savory and delicious, the chicken skin batter wasn't overly saucy, chewy or dry.
It had a good crunch while maintaining shape.
I ordered very spicy but wasn't impressed of the spice level.
I have a pretty High tolerance for spicy (chilli) food.
The portion was perfect.
Not too little portion but just right.
Delivery was quick!
Will order again
white rice.author: Jennifer N.
white rice.review: I ordered the Korean fried chicken lunch meal and it came with white rice, hot & sour soup and egg roll. The fried chicken was savory and delicious, the chicken skin batter wasn't overly saucy, chewy or dry. It had a good crunch while maintaining shape. I ordered very spicy but wasn't impressed of the spice level. I have a pretty High tolerance for spicy (chilli) food. The portion was perfect. Not too little portion but just right. Delivery was quick! Will order again

excerpts: It's cool that they let you choose between white rice, brown rice, egg fried rice or chow mein.
white rice.author: Bonnie S.
white rice.review:
Ordered some lunch specials for me and my friends to be delivered. The piping hot food came in 35 minutes after we put in our order and also came with bonus egg rolls and soup. Heck yeah!

My friends got the garlic eggplant and honey walnut shrimp which was good. It's cool that they let you choose between white rice, brown rice, egg fried rice or chow mein.

My only complaint is that the lemon chicken was super dry and rough because they used white meat and could have fried it too long... but it was still edible. Just wish they used dark meat instead. I should have gotten the vegetarian chicken! 

Their menu is pretty extensive and affordable so next time I want to get the crab rangoons!

excerpts: They always include a side of steamed white rice free of charge, whether it truly is included or I guess I'm nice enough to get some free rice?
Regardless, they've always been lovely to me every time I order.
And the food is really good.
Every once in awhile I try to break free from my boring healthy habits (I blame you, Barry's Bootcamp) and give in to my cravings.
This stuff definitely hits the spot.
If you dine in, it's quite cozy.
As in, there's only a few tables.
But it's a cute little spot to grab
a quick (yummy) bite then continue on your way.
white rice.author: Ali A.
white rice.review:
My only experiences with this place have been strictly for take out - but the service has always been fast and friendly. First off, San Francisco sucks for food. I know everyone says this is a great place for new culinary experiences but no. You get jipped on everything. (Since when do I have to order rice separate of my chicken tikka masala?! Sacrilege) However, this place reminds me of what it was like ordering food in New York - you actually get a complete meal without going bankrupt. My personal favorites are the sesame and general tso's chicken. They always include a side of steamed white rice free of charge, whether it truly is included or I guess I'm nice enough to get some free rice? Regardless, they've always been lovely to me every time I order. And the food is really good. Every once in awhile I try to break free from my boring healthy habits (I blame you, Barry's Bootcamp) and give in to my cravings. This stuff definitely hits the spot. 
If you dine in, it's quite cozy. As in, there's only a few tables. But it's a cute little spot to grab a quick (yummy) bite then continue on your way.

excerpts: I ordered the Crispy Dragon Beef ($7.75 for lunch specials comes with soup and white rice) as reccommended by another reviewer, it was a sweet indulgent.
I will return if I'm ever in the area!
white rice.author: Apple S.
white rice.review: I came here after playing tourist at The Palace of Fine Arts. By far the best Chinese take-out. The food is so cheap,  tastey, large portioned, and fast. I ordered the Crispy Dragon Beef ($7.75 for lunch specials comes with soup and white rice) as reccommended by another reviewer, it was a sweet indulgent. I will return if I'm ever in the area!

excerpts: I got prawns and snow peas with white rice...
I hate peas and white rice.
Getting one thing wrong was an honest mistake, getting both parts in the order wrong seems intentional.
So basically I'll be avoiding this place for now on.
white rice.author: Tom L.
white rice.review: I have been to this restaurant a couple of times, the food was good but the fruit flies are out of control in the restuarant. So i decided to get take out for lunch instead of fighting off flies the whole time. I ordered prawns and lobster sauce with chow mein...  I got prawns and snow peas with white rice... I hate peas and white rice. Getting one thing wrong was an honest mistake, getting both parts in the order wrong seems intentional. So basically I'll be avoiding this place for now on.

excerpts: I ordered the veggie chow fun and the dim sum shrimp dumplings!
Both were super yummy.
Gluten eating hubby ordered the chow mein and sweet and sour Chix lunch special, which also came with soup and an egg roll.
He loved it!
We will definitely be back.
shrimp dumplings.author: Crystal H.
shrimp dumplings.review: Small little spot. Delicious Chinese food. Great prices. Gluten Free friendly! They keep gluten free tamari soy sauce on hand and are happy to modify a dish to make it gluten free. I ordered the veggie chow fun and the dim sum shrimp dumplings! Both were super yummy. Gluten eating hubby ordered the chow mein and sweet and sour Chix lunch special, which also came with soup and an egg roll. He loved it! We will definitely be back.

excerpts: It says on the menu that it includes 2 of each of the items, shrimp dumplings, pork buns and siu mai.
So we were expecting 2 shrimp dumplings, 2 pork buns, and 2 siu mai.
So we were expecting 2 shrimp dumplings, 2 pork buns, and 2 siu mai.
Imagine our surprise when we found 4 shrimp dumplings, 2 siu mai, and no pork buns!
Imagine our surprise when we found 4 shrimp dumplings, 2 siu mai, and no pork buns!
shrimp dumplings.author: S K.
shrimp dumplings.review:
If this is the only Chinese place within miles, I would probably give it a begrudging pass. But this is in the city with the oldest Chinatown in the US, the bar must be set much higher.
This is a review of the delivery service.
When we placed the order, the delivery time was 45-60 minutes. We did not get our order for 1:45. This is already a big no-no. The restaurant did not call to let us know the delay.
One of the menu items was the dimsum combination plate. It says on the menu that it includes 2 of each of the items, shrimp dumplings, pork buns and siu mai. So we were expecting 2 shrimp dumplings, 2 pork buns, and 2 siu mai. Imagine our surprise when we found 4 shrimp dumplings, 2 siu mai, and no pork buns! Another big no-no!

Let's not even take into consideration that if this is take-out food, you will probably want utensils. None was to be found!

OK, now let's get into the food itself. The dimsum was just OK, our expectations completely ruined by the discrepancy in the actual items.
The walnut prawns was not bad. But remember what I said about the location? Take a walk down to Wonderland and you will find much better walnut prawns.
The Hunan tofu was decent, probably the best dish we got. The Yang Chow fried rice was so-so. Again, I've had better, probably Red Jade.

Overall, I think if I rate the food itself, it's probably 3.5 stars. But the service was definitely subpar. Remember, this is San Francisco, competition is going to be stiff at best.
We will probably not get food from here again.

excerpts: I got the veggie chow mein, pork potstickers, dim sum combination plate (two pork buns, two shrimp dumplings, two sui mai),
shrimp dumplings.author: Emma B.
shrimp dumplings.review:
This place was just OK for American Chinese food delivery. There are other places in the city I like more and I don't plan on ordering from here again.

I got the veggie chow mein, pork potstickers, dim sum combination plate (two pork buns, two shrimp dumplings, two sui mai), General Tso's, and crab rangoon.

The veggie chow mein was tasteless, the dim sum was bland, and the crab rangoon was really fishy and the shell was thick and tough.

The General Tso's was the best dish, but still pretty average. I was pleased with the delivery time - it came quicker than estimated. The portions were also generous.

excerpts: Shrimp dumplings were average (like would eat them again) but I was so disappointed by the shrimp fried rice (which I think is a dish that Chinese restaurants should do well) that I had to give the 1 star.
shrimp dumplings.author: S W.
shrimp dumplings.review:
Ordered takeout and everything was disappointing. Had shrimp fried rice and it badly needed salt and the rice tasted like it had been nuked in a microwave for a while, it was about as good as frozen fried rice that you microwave. I'm also sensitive to salt so the fact that I thought it was bland says a lot. 

The hot and sour soup was better, a bit on the too sour side but was decent. 

Shrimp dumplings were average (like would eat them again) but I was so disappointed by the shrimp fried rice (which I think is a dish that Chinese restaurants should do well) that I had to give the 1 star.

excerpts: Tips: Get the shrimp dumplings.
Thank me later.
Also, don't know what you want?
Ask Andy.
He'll guide you to something delicious and sometimes something he just whips up off menu.
shrimp dumplings.author: Josef N.
shrimp dumplings.review:
This is the best restaurant in NOPA. Hands down. This is our neighborhood go to spot. It's not some pretentious spot where people love to tell everyone how long they waited for a reservation, it's just a great restaurant, serving delicious food, run by a guy who always makes you feel welcome. Honestly, it's places like this that create the soul of a neighborhood. 

Tips: Get the shrimp dumplings. Thank me later.
Also, don't know what you want? Ask Andy. He'll guide you to something delicious and sometimes something he just whips up off menu.

excerpts: I ordered the vegetable sizzling rice soup & shrimp dumplings.
Both are excellent!
The soup is full of zucchini, asparagus, mushroom, carrot & watercress.
Yum!
Go checkout why everybody is raving about Kung Food.
shrimp dumplings.author: Susan L.
shrimp dumplings.review: This newly open restaurant in NOPA is perfect for those cold San Francisco nights. I ordered the vegetable sizzling rice soup & shrimp dumplings. Both are excellent! The soup is full of zucchini, asparagus, mushroom, carrot & watercress. Yum! Go checkout why everybody is raving about Kung Food.

excerpts: I had ordered for delivery the pork fried rice, hot and sour soup and steamed vegetable dumplings.
The delivery was fast and the food was hot.
However, the dumplings were not tasty, they were doughy and bland.
The soup had a bit too much sour and not enough hot while the fried rice was dry and missing a lacking  in egg, vegetables and pork.
Skimpy comes to mind.
I love Chinese food and would try Kung again, but if any other alternative is available I would choose that first.
steamed vegetable dumplings.author: Elias W.
steamed vegetable dumplings.review: I had ordered for delivery the pork fried rice, hot and sour soup and steamed vegetable dumplings.   The delivery was fast and the food was hot.  However, the dumplings were not tasty, they were doughy and bland.  The soup had a bit too much sour and not enough hot while the fried rice was dry and missing a lacking  in egg, vegetables and pork.  Skimpy comes to mind.   I love Chinese food and would try Kung again, but if any other alternative is available I would choose that first.

excerpts: I got the orange chicken lunch special, which comes with a cup of hot and sour soup.
orange chicken lunch special.author: Marco F.
orange chicken lunch special.review:
My first time here was amazing. Glad i finally got the chance to come back.

I got the orange chicken lunch special, which comes with a cup of hot and sour soup. I'm not usually a fan of hot and sour but theirs is pretty darn good. 

The orange chicken was perfectly crispy and not over cooked. Fried rice was super rich.

Service was friendly and quick. 

If you are ever in the mood for awesome Chinese food,  then this is the place to go!

excerpts: I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with a side of fried rice and an order of vegetable pot stickers.
The pot stickers were deep-fried, which was unexpected
but I was curious to try.
They were rubbery and flavorless.
The fried rice was so salty I could taste nothing else.
The orange chicken was tough and dry.
I could only stomach a few bites of both.
Just because I was hungry doesn't mean I was going subject myself to that.
I didn't try the soup that came with the meal out of fear of what it might taste like.
The only decent thing was the free egg roll.
orange chicken lunch special.author: Angee R.
orange chicken lunch special.review:
I figured I'd write this review while my food is in the trash and the awful experience is fresh in my mind. There are a few Chinese restaurants in the city I usually order them but today I decided to try something new. I find myself hungry, upset that I wasted $17(tip included), and wishing I had ordered from somewhere else. 
 
The service I received was horrible. That alone is enough to stop me from ever ordering there again. I wish that was all that was wrong because the way I see it even though the lack of customer service would have made sure this would the first and last time I ever gave them my money I would have decent or good food. Unfortunately, that was not the case.

I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with a side of fried rice and an order of vegetable pot stickers. The pot stickers were deep-fried, which was unexpected but I was curious to try. They were rubbery and flavorless. The fried rice was so salty I could taste nothing else. The orange chicken was tough and dry. I could only stomach a few bites of both. Just because I was hungry doesn't mean I was going subject myself to that. I didn't try the soup that came with the meal out of fear of what it might taste like. The only decent thing was the free egg roll.

excerpts: I got the Mongolian Beef lunch special and requested no white/yellow/red onion.
I mentioned that green onions were okay, though.
I also requested hot chili oil in a condiment cup, if they had any.
And they delivered on both requests.
mongolian beef lunch special.author: Sarah B.
mongolian beef lunch special.review:
I ordered takeout on Kung Food's website and left work, hoping my food would be ready once I arrived. It was! 

I got the Mongolian Beef lunch special and requested no white/yellow/red onion. I mentioned that green onions were okay, though. I also requested hot chili oil in a condiment cup, if they had any. And they delivered on both requests. It means a lot when places that are churning out dishes pretty quickly are able to accommodate these types of requests, so I definitely appreciate that. 

The portion size, even for lunch, is quite large, so I was able to make three meals out of it. The beef was tender and flavorful, and it wasn't overly sauce-y or dry.

excerpts: She showed me lunch menu and was surprised by the amount of items listed, that such a place had so many options and decided on the mango beef lunch special.
We called ahead and placed an order, since parking there is a hit or miss there.

When we got there, we actually found parking and went inside to pick up our orders and asked if it was ok if we ate there even though we ordered to go and they were super nice about it and said it was ok and even gave us silverware and served us tea
The mango beef was definitely good!
I was glad that I could order it without it being spicy.
I know at other chinese places, they cannot modify the level of eliminate the spiciness of their food since its premade ahead of time.
mango beef lunch special.author: Julie T.
mango beef lunch special.review: My friend Kim suggested we come try this place out, since they just opened up nearby and decided to give this place a try and grab some lunch together. She showed me lunch menu and was surprised by the amount of items listed, that such a place had so many options and decided on the mango beef lunch special. We called ahead and placed an order, since parking there is a hit or miss there. When we got there, we actually found parking and went inside to pick up our orders and asked if it was ok if we ate there even though we ordered to go and they were super nice about it and said it was ok and even gave us silverware and served us tea :) The mango beef was definitely good! I was glad that I could order it without it being spicy. I know at other chinese places, they cannot modify the level of eliminate the spiciness of their food since its premade ahead of time.
